resources.string: To get started with EmberIot, make sure you\'ve created a n app in your Firebase Console and enabled the Authentication and Realtime Database modules. Once that\'s done, you can provide the necessary connection details. This can be done in two ways: you can either upload a google-services.json file or type the information manually on the next screen. Either way, you\'ll need to create an app in your Firebase Console.
Step 1: In the Firebase Console, navigate to Project Settings.
Step 2: Under the General tab, click the Add App button and select the Android platform.
Step 3: Set the package name to com.emberiot.emberiot and continue (you don\'t need to fill in the \"optional\" fields).
Step 4: Download the google-services.json file provided after continuing.
Step 5: Click the done button below, you will then need to upload the google-services.json file here.

Your project is all set up! Now, you\'ll just need to create a user in your Firebase Console, and that\'ll be the one used to sign into the app. You can add as many users as you want and have them sign in on different devices too, if you\'d like.
Step 1: Go to the Firebase Authentication page within the console.
Step 3: Enter the new user\'s info and add the user.
Step 4: When that\'s done, click the \"Done\" button below.
